item.title: Q promises with CoffeeScript
item.description: If you are using NodeJS (or for some other reasons you need to do many async invocations), then you probably came across “https://github.com/kriskowal/q”. Using Q with CoffeeScript is great as code blocks are much more organized and looks cleaner. Here’s an example: Defining promises with CoffeeScript: q = require 'q' exports.hello = () -> d = q.defer() d.resolve 'hello' d.promise exports.world = () -> d = q.defer() d.resolve 'world' d.promise exports.
